Detailed Description

The CRecursiveMutex class wraps a native FreeRTOS recursive mutex handle (xSemaphoreHandle). To create a recursive mutex instance an object of this class and then call its CRecursiveMutex::Create method like showed in the following sample: 

 CRecursiveMutex g_aRecursiveMutex // global mutex declaration.

 void taskControlFunc(void *pParams)
 {
       g_aRecursiveMutex.Create();

       for (;;) {
              while (g_aRecursiveMutex.Take(portMAX_DELAY) != pdTRUE) {
              // do something
              }
 }
See also:
recursive mutex documentation in the FreeRTOS web site.
Date:
Jul 14, 2010

Definition at line 37 of file CRecursiveMutex.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CRecursiveMutex::CRecursiveMutex ( )

Default constructor. It initializes the object without attaching it to a native FreeRTOS handle. Call the Create method to allocate a mutex handle and attach it to the object.
